intro: Pimpinella anthriscoides, commonly known as the lesser cow parsley, is a biennial or short-lived perennial plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in umbels. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along riverbanks. The plant is also known for its mild, parsley-like scent and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
